item.title: How to loop music with intro in Unity
item.description: Those of you who have a bit of experience using Unity, probably know that to play an audio loop you just need to create an AudioSource, assign an AudioClip and check the box that says Loop. But that’s not exactly what I’m here to talk about.

item.title: Game optimization tricks and anecdotes
item.description: To start this year 2024, I thought of writing about various techniques, tricks and curiosities on how to optimize a game, based on what I have seen in the projects I port to consoles.

item.title: Appreciation of old software design
item.description: Something that I like a lot and that was quite common in the 90’s and 2000’s but has been completely lost since then is the way in which the interfaces of some games or software were designed.

item.title: A rant about GameMaker texture management
item.description: I’m currently porting an indie game done with GameMaker to consoles. And each time I have to deal with this engine, one thing that pisses me off is how it handles textures.

item.title: The state of the Internet
item.description: In the 1990s and early 2000s, the Internet was made up of many small websites. Many people had their own personal website where they posted things they did, or commented on things they liked, or wrote about what they thought or felt.

item.title: A big inspiration
item.description: From time to time some events happen in your life that, for one reason or another, end up changing your future. And there was a game that, back in 2002, was one of the main reasons of my big interest in game development.
